item.title: Hazardous rubbish in garden/ pavement of 196 Herbert Road, 6th February
item.description:
There is a pile of flytipped rubbish in the driveway of 196 Herbert Road. Oil running out of the pile, which has created an iridescent trail onto the pavement of Whitworth Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whitworth Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very overgrown oak tree with very low hanging branches and the height is well exceeding the properties in close proximity, 6th February
item.description:
The oak tree on Broomhill Common opposite 56, 58 & 60 Broomhill Road is extremely overgrown, blocking out light to the houses and the branches are very very low hanging. Potentially could start to cause problems to existing houses and their foundations.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomhill Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamppost 1 - Radlett Place, 6th February
item.description:
Lamppost was hit by a delivery vehicle today (6th Feb) at about 11am.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Radlett Place, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Causing a dangerous public nuisance, 6th February
item.description:
This car has not yet been untaxed for 2 months and 1 day although it did expire on 1 Feb. I am aware this means the council will not take action but can action be taken on the basis it is a health and safety hazard. Having been broken into and vandalised there is once again glass and debris on the street. Every time this is cleaned up it happens again. It’s not good enough. The entire community knows that this was dumped by Marwan Motors just like all the other cars parked untaxed and in disrepair around the common.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wernbrook Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still lots of rubbish in the Herbert Terrace green bank, 6th February
item.description:
This area (between Herbert Terrace and Herbert Road) has been cleaned recently but, due to the huge amount of pre-existing rubbish and flytipping there, is stil looking bad. It needs further litter picking/ cleaning, including some larger items and broken glass.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Herbert Road, Woolwich

item.title: Pot Hole, 6th February
item.description:
This pot hole has been there for months and gradually getting bigger. It has caused my tire to have a slow puncture. Needs sorting out ASAP - people are also driving on the opposite side of the road to avoid it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead

item.title: Huge amount of broken paving slabs in glenhurst avenue, 6th February
item.description:
A resident has called today to state there is a large amount of paving slabs in glenhurst avenue that are broken and uneven. This caused the resident to fall over yesterday, this is a hazard and needs to be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Glenhurst Avenue, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin that does not belong to any neighbours was next to neighbours’ bins and public were dumping rubbish., 6th February
item.description:
This has been an issue for as long as I’ve lived here (3 years) and myself and our neighbours have been cleaning it up. The bin men often don’t take all the rubbish as it doesn’t belong to a house. I have now moved the bin in hopes it doesn’t get used for dumping onto my driveway. I cleaned up the recent mess as it was causing fox issues and it’s a concern for pests and health and safety. It’s now with me at Poppy Villa (next to the location I pinned). Feel free to ring the bell but if we’re not in then go ahead and take it. It’s the small black bin with no lid, and some rubbish bags in it, next to our other two big bins (1 green and 1 black) closest to the street by our car (black Volkswagen Golf). Thanks very much.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castledine Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 9-11 hollycroft, 6th February
item.description:
In Feb 25 I reported unsafe roadway (photo attached) which you acknowledged REF 7146523 (copy attached). Today, from adjacent yellow lamppost signs i see you are addressing these problems on 18 Feb - in 12 days time - but there is no yellow sign on my lamppost. Please can you add my request to your planned works. Please confirm this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollycroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 17 CHARTERHOUSE Street, 6th February
item.description:
Temp road sign left behind from street diversions has become a trip hazard - 2 people have tripped over it this week as it keeps being knocked or blown over and lies flat on the ground where it’s not easy to see when it’s dark. Currently propped against the bus stop
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shoe Lane, City of London
